Pre-Game Insights: England is trying not to think about being underdogs against South Africa, with lock Maro Itoje saying they are a good team but so are we.
South Africa has 15 survivors from the 2019 World Cup final, and their coach Jacques Nienaber has settled on his best team.
England has made two changes to their pack, with lock George Martin and prop Joe Marler coming in.
The Springboks have a more polished operation out wide, underlined by the presence of attacking flyhalf Manie Libbok.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa leads the overall head-to-head against England 27-2-16, and 4-1 in RWC.
The odds for South Africa vs England are South Africa $1.16 and England $4.16.
The match will be broadcast on Sky Sport 1 from 7.45am Sunday.
Others: The match will take place in Paris on Sunday NZT.
The weather might be wet in Saint-Denis on Saturday night.
South Africa captain Siya Kolisi said they know exactly what England will bring and the motivation they have.
